chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: In order to make RestComm easy to manage all of the configuration is done in only one file. The file is located at PATH_TO_DEPLOYMENT_DIRECTORY/restcomm/conf/restcomm.xml and is composed of the following sections:

row.entry: An index of RestComm applications to be executed.
Manages storage on behalf of RestComm.

section.title: Application Index
section.para: An application index as the name implies is an index containing all the applications that will be executed by RestComm.
The default application index is configured below by providing a list of applications that should be executed by RestComm. Each application MUST have a name and the following properties:

row.entry: The endpoint to which the application will bind.
The HTTP method used to request the application's entry point.
The HTTP URI to the application's entry point.

section.para: The application index may also contain an optional list of client mappings which can be used with the <Client> noun in RestComm applications.
section.note: Endpoint will usually be a DID in E.164 format (ex. +14445556666)

section.title: Gateway Manager
section.para: The gateway manager controls access to the gateways used to reach other networks like the PSTN.
The default gateway manager is used to manage SIP gateways and is configured below by providing a SIP gateway that will be used by RestComm. The gateway MUST have a name and the following properties:

row.entry: The user name to use for registration.
The password to use for registration.
A true/false value indicating if the service provider requires registration. (See road map for availability)
The FQDN or IP address to the SIP proxy.

section.title: Media Server Manager
section.para: The media server manager is responsible for managing the media servers in use by RestComm.
The default way to control media servers is using the MGCP stack. The MGCP stack MUST have a name and the following properties:

row.entry: The local IP address for the MGCP stack.
The local port for the MGCP stack.
The IP address for the media server.
The port for the media server.

section.title: SMS Aggregator
section.para: The SMS aggregator is responsible for the handling of SMS messages inside of RestComm.

The default SMS aggregator uses public email-2-sms gateways to transmit text messages to the mobile networks. Please keep in mind that this is a free service and must not be abused so that it can remain available and FREE.

row.entry: The domain from which emails are being sent.
The SMTP mail server to use for sending emails to the SMS gateway.
The email-2-sms gateway. A list can be found @ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_SMS_gateways.

section.para: Please pay attention to the format expected by the service providers.

section.title: Storage
section.para: The Storage system is responsible for storing RestComm objects.
The default storage system uses the filesystem to store the RestComm objects.

row.entry: The location on the file system to use for storage.
The HTTP URI to the storage location.
